DEVICE STRUCTURE:
***Device***
Name: NuCore Smart Thermostat X1
  ***Properties***
    Current Temperature
      Range 5.0 to 35.0 Unit °C
    Target Temperature
      Range 10.0 to 30.0 Unit °C
    Mode
      Enum
        Off [0]
        Heat [1]
        Cool [2]
        Auto [3]
    Fan Speed
      Enum
        Low [0]
        Medium [1]
        High [2]
        Auto [3]
  ***Accept Commands***
    Set Target Temperature [STT]
      Parameter 1: []
        Range 10.0 to 30.0 Unit °C
    Set Mode [SM]
      Parameter 1: []
        Enum
          Off [0]
          Heat [1]
          Cool [2]
          Auto [3]
    Set Fan Speed [SFS]
      Parameter 1: []
        Enum
          Low [0]
          Medium [1]
          High [2]
          Auto [3]
    Query Status [QS]
  ***Send Commands***
    Report Temperature [RT]
    Report Mode [RM]
    Report Fan Speed [RFS]

USER QUERY:
Can you set the thermostat to 22 degrees Celsius in heat mode and set the fan speed to medium?

First, I review the device properties and commands. The thermostat supports setting a target temperature between 10.0 and 30.0 °C, modes including Off, Heat, Cool, and Auto, and fan speeds Low, Medium, High, and Auto. 

The user wants to set the target temperature to 22 °C, mode to Heat, and fan speed to Medium. 

To accomplish this, I will use the following accepted commands with parameters:
- Set Target Temperature [STT] with parameter 22.0 °C
- Set Mode [SM] with parameter Heat [1]
- Set Fan Speed [SFS] with parameter Medium [1]

Result: Execute STT(22.0), SM(Heat), and SFS(Medium) to configure the thermostat as requested.
You are a smart home assistant and NuCore expert.

DEVICE STRUCTURE:
***Device***
Name: NuCore Smart Light Panel
  ***Properties***
    Brightness
      Range 0 to 100 Unit %
    Color Temperature
      Range 2700 to 6500 Unit K
    Power Status
      Enum
        Off [0]
        On [1]
  ***Accept Commands***
    Turn On [ON]
    Turn Off [OFF]
    Set Brightness [SB]
      Parameter 1: []
        Range 0 to 100 Unit %
    Set Color Temperature [SCT]
      Parameter 1: []
        Range 2700 to 6500 Unit K
    Query Status [QS]
  ***Send Commands***
    Report Brightness [RB]
    Report Color Temperature [RCT]
    Report Power Status [RPS]

USER QUERY:
I want to dim the light panel to 40% brightness and set the color temperature to a warm 3000 Kelvin. How do I do that?

The device properties include Brightness (0-100%) and Color Temperature (2700-6500 K). The accepted commands to adjust these are Set Brightness [SB] and Set Color Temperature [SCT], each requiring a parameter within the specified ranges.

The user wants 40% brightness and 3000 K color temperature, both within valid ranges.

Therefore, the commands to send are:
- SB with parameter 40
- SCT with parameter 3000

Result: Use Set Brightness(40) and Set Color Temperature(3000) commands to dim the light panel and set the warm color temperature as requested.
You are a smart home assistant and NuCore expert.

DEVICE STRUCTURE:
***Device***
Name: NuCore Energy Meter Pro
  ***Properties***
    Current Power Usage
      Range 0 to 5000 Unit W
    Total Energy Consumed
      Range 0 to 10000 Unit kWh
    Status
      Enum
        Normal [0]
        Warning [1]
        Error [2]
  ***Accept Commands***
    Reset Energy Counter [REC]
    Query Power Usage [QPU]
    Query Energy Consumed [QEC]
    Query Status [QS]
  ***Send Commands***
    Report Power Usage [RPU]
    Report Energy Consumed [REC]
    Report Status [RS]

USER QUERY:
How can I check the current power usage and reset the total energy consumed counter?

The device properties include Current Power Usage (0-5000 W) and Total Energy Consumed (0-10000 kWh). The accepted commands allow querying power usage [QPU], energy consumed [QEC], and resetting the energy counter [REC].

To check current power usage, send the Query Power Usage [QPU] command. To reset the total energy consumed counter, send the Reset Energy Counter [REC] command.

Result: Execute QPU to get current power usage, then execute REC to reset the total energy consumed counter as requested.
You are a smart home assistant and NuCore expert.

DEVICE STRUCTURE:
***Device***
Name: NuCore Smart Ceiling Fan
  ***Properties***
    Power Status
      Enum
        Off [0]
        On [1]
    Speed Level
      Range 0 to 5 Unit Level
        Off [0]
    Direction
      Enum
        Forward [0]
        Reverse [1]
  ***Accept Commands***
    Turn On [ON]
    Turn Off [OFF]
    Set Speed [SS]
      Parameter 1: []
        Range 0 to 5 Unit Level
    Set Direction [SD]
      Parameter 1: []
        Enum
          Forward [0]
          Reverse [1]
    Query Status [QS]
  ***Send Commands***
    Report Speed [RS]
    Report Direction [RD]
    Report Power Status [RPS]

USER QUERY:
Please turn on the ceiling fan, set speed to 3, and reverse the direction.

The device supports turning on/off, setting speed levels from 0 to 5, and changing direction between Forward and Reverse.

The user wants to turn the fan on, set speed to 3, and set direction to Reverse.

Commands to send:
- Turn On [ON]
- Set Speed [SS] with parameter 3
- Set Direction [SD] with parameter Reverse [1]

Result: Execute ON, SS(3), and SD(Reverse) commands to fulfill the request.
You are a smart home assistant and NuCore expert.

DEVICE STRUCTURE:
***Device***
Name: NuCore Smart Window Shade
  ***Properties***
    Position
      Range 0 to 100 Unit %
        Fully Closed [0]
        Fully Open [100]
    Status
      Enum
        Stopped [0]
        Moving Up [1]
        Moving Down [2]
  ***Accept Commands***
    Open Shade [OPEN]
    Close Shade [CLOSE]
    Set Position [SP]
      Parameter 1: []
        Range 0 to 100 Unit %
    Stop Movement [STOP]
    Query Position [QP]
  ***Send Commands***
    Report Position [RP]
    Report Status [RS]

USER QUERY:
Can you open the window shade halfway and then stop it if it starts moving too fast?

The device properties include Position (0-100%) where 0% is fully closed and 100% fully open, and Status indicating if the shade is stopped or moving up/down.

To open the shade halfway, set Position to 50% using the Set Position [SP] command with parameter 50.

If the shade starts moving too fast, the Stop Movement [STOP] command can be sent to halt it.

Result: Send SP(50) to open halfway, and if needed, send STOP to stop movement.
You are a smart home assistant and NuCore expert.

DEVICE STRUCTURE:
***Device***
Name: NuCore Smart Door Lock
  ***Properties***
    Lock Status
      Enum
        Locked [0]
        Unlocked [1]
    Battery Level
      Range 0 to 100 Unit %
  ***Accept Commands***
    Lock Door [LOCK]
    Unlock Door [UNLOCK]
    Query Lock Status [QLS]
    Query Battery Level [QBL]
  ***Send Commands***
    Report Lock Status [RLS]
    Report Battery Level [RBL]

USER QUERY:
Is the door locked right now and what is the battery level?

The device has properties Lock Status (Locked or Unlocked) and Battery Level (0-100%). To find out if the door is locked and the battery level, we use the Query Lock Status [QLS] and Query Battery Level [QBL] commands.

By sending QLS, we get the current lock state. By sending QBL, we get the battery percentage.

Result: Execute QLS to check if the door is locked, and QBL to retrieve the battery level.
You are a smart home assistant and NuCore expert.

DEVICE STRUCTURE:
***Device***
Name: NuCore Smart Sprinkler Controller
  ***Properties***
    Zone Status
      Enum
        Off [0]
        On [1]
    Water Flow Rate
      Range 0 to 20 Unit L/min
    Schedule Enabled
      Enum
        Disabled [0]
        Enabled [1]
  ***Accept Commands***
    Start Zone [SZ]
      Parameter 1: []
        Range 1 to 6 Unit Zone Number
    Stop Zone [STZ]
      Parameter 1: []
        Range 1 to 6 Unit Zone Number
    Enable Schedule [ES]
    Disable Schedule [DS]
    Query Status [QS]
  ***Send Commands***
    Report Zone Status [RZS]
    Report Flow Rate [RFR]
    Report Schedule Status [RSS]

USER QUERY:
Please start watering zone 3 and enable the schedule.

The device supports starting and stopping watering zones numbered 1 to 6, enabling or disabling the watering schedule, and reporting statuses.

The user wants to start watering zone 3 and enable the schedule.

Commands to send:
- Start Zone [SZ] with parameter 3
- Enable Schedule [ES]

Result: Execute SZ(3) to start watering zone 3 and ES to enable the schedule as requested.
You are a smart home assistant and NuCore expert.

DEVICE STRUCTURE:
***Device***
Name: NuCore Smart Garage Door Opener
  ***Properties***
    Door Position
      Range 0 to 100 Unit %
        Closed [0]
        Open [100]
    Motor Status
      Enum
        Stopped [0]
        Opening [1]
        Closing [2]
  ***Accept Commands***
    Open Door [OPEN]
    Close Door [CLOSE]
    Stop Door [STOP]
    Set Position [SP]
      Parameter 1: []
        Range 0 to 100 Unit %
    Query Position [QP]
  ***Send Commands***
    Report Position [RP]
    Report Motor Status [RMS]

USER QUERY:
Can you open the garage door halfway and then stop it if needed?

The device properties include Door Position (0-100%) and Motor Status (Stopped, Opening, Closing).

To open the door halfway, set the position to 50% using the Set Position [SP] command with parameter 50.

If the door needs to be stopped at any time, the Stop Door [STOP] command can be sent.

Result: Send SP(50) to open halfway, and if necessary, send STOP to halt the door movement.
You are a smart home assistant and NuCore expert.

DEVICE STRUCTURE:
***Device***
Name: NuCore Smart Air Purifier
  ***Properties***
    Power Status
      Enum
        Off [0]
        On [1]
    Fan Speed
      Enum
        Low [0]
        Medium [1]
        High [2]
    Air Quality Index
      Range 0 to 500 Unit AQI
  ***Accept Commands***
    Turn On [ON]
    Turn Off [OFF]
    Set Fan Speed [SFS]
      Parameter 1: []
        Enum
          Low [0]
          Medium [1]
          High [2]
    Query Air Quality [QAQ]
  ***Send Commands***
    Report Fan Speed [RFS]
    Report Air Quality [RAQ]
    Report Power Status [RPS]

USER QUERY:
Turn on the air purifier and set the fan speed to high. Also, can you tell me the current air quality index?

The device supports turning on/off, setting fan speed (Low, Medium, High), and reporting air quality index (0-500 AQI).

The user wants to turn on the purifier, set fan speed to High, and get the current air quality.

Commands to send:
- Turn On [ON]
- Set Fan Speed [SFS] with parameter High [2]
- Query Air Quality [QAQ]

Result: Execute ON, SFS(High), and QAQ commands to fulfill the request.
